JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Company profile

Eurofins BioPharma Product Testing Denmark A/S is a world-leading global contract laboratory in the pharmaceutical field, providing the pharmaceutical industry with microbiological and chemical analyses, process control, and consulting services for laboratory services according to GMP. 

The microbiological laboratory in Glostrup performs microbiological analyses of pharmaceutical products for many Danish and some foreign companies. We conduct a wide range of different analyses, so no two days are ever the same with us. 

Job description

We are seeking a highly motivated and result driven Team Leader to join our Microbiology Department. We perform classical microbiological methods according to Ph. Eur., USP and ISO, microbiological identification by MicroSeq and Maldi-TOF, endotoxin testing, growth promotion test, hygiene monitoring, validations etc.  

As a Team Leader, you will play a pivotal role in driving operational excellence, ensuring compliance with GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), and leading a dynamic team of professionals. The department consists of 36 employees covering microbiologists, laboratory technicians, laboratory assistants, QC assistants, student assistants, team leaders and department manager. 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Leadership & Employee Retention: Provide leadership to microbiology staff, fostering a positive and engaging work environment. Promote a culture of teamwork, continuous learning, and career development to retain talents. 
  • Coordination of Analysis: Oversee the planning, execution, and reporting of microbiological analysis including taking part in the release of CoAs. Ensure that all analyses are performed and reported in a timely, accurate, and compliant manner. 
  • GMP & Compliance: Ensure strict adherence to GMP standards and regulatory requirements in all microbiological operations. Support internal and external audits, and proactively address any compliance issues, including deviation handling and approval.  
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with company objectives and seamless coordination in microbiology-related activities. 
  • Customer Relations: Maintain and enhance strong relationships with customers, ensuring their microbiological testing requirements are met. Provide timely and accurate updates, address customer concerns, and work closely with clients to understand their needs. 
  • Continuous Improvement: Drive initiatives for process optimization, efficiency improvements, and the introduction of best practices. 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Microbiology, Life Sciences, or a related field. 
  • QC experience, with at least 1 year in a leadership or supervisory role. 
  • Knowledge of GMP, regulatory compliance, and quality systems. 
  • Understanding of Lean principles and implementing continuous improvement initiatives. 
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. 
  • Proven ability to manage/coordinate teams, resolve conflicts, and foster a positive workplace culture. 
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously 
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills, with the ability to build strong relationships withboth internal teams and customers 
  • Ability to set goals and deliver on KPIs 
  • Fluent in Danish and English – verbally and in writing 

What do we offer? 
We offer an exciting Team leader position in a dynamic company, with excellent opportunities for personal and professional development, as well as an inspiring work environment. You will have a varied daily routine in a fast-paced workplace with a positive atmosphere and an informal tone. 
You will become an important part of our dedicated and skilled department, where the focus is on efficiency and quality. 

 

Additional information

Workplace: Ørnebjergvej 1, 2600 Glostrup 
Start Date: As soon as possible 

Application: 
Please send your CV, application, and other relevant documents as soon as possible by clicking "I am interested." Applications sent via email will not be considered. We conduct ongoing interviews and will hire as soon as the right candidate is found. 
As part of the hiring process, you will be asked to provide a criminal record certificate. 

For further information about the position, feel free to contact Department Manager Nanna Høgholm Buch-Pedersen at +45 26 86 43 23. 

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company offering a unique range of analytical services to clients across various industries, with the goal of making life and our environment safer, healthier, and more sustainable. From the food you eat to the water you drink to the medicines you use, Eurofins works with some of the world’s largest companies to ensure that the products they offer are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and their product labels are accurate. Eurofins is a global leader in the testing of food, environmental, pharmaceutical, and cosmetic products, as well as agro-science CRO services. Furthermore, Eurofins is one of the global market leaders in specific testing and laboratory services in genomics, pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced materials science, and clinical trial support.

In just over 30 years, Eurofins has grown from a single laboratory in Nantes, France, to a network of more than 1,000 independent companies and 900 laboratories in over 62 countries, employing 62,000 people. Eurofins offers a portfolio of more than 200,000 analytical methods to assess the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability, and purity of biological substances and products. As one of the leading players in specialized clinical diagnostic testing, we also provide innovative clinical diagnostic testing services.

In 2023, Eurofins generated total revenues of €6.515 billion and is among the best-performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.
